meanings.definition: To become less appealing or interesting
meanings.sent1: The movie palled after the first few minutes, and I lost interest.
meanings.sent2: As the party went on, the music palled, and people started leaving.
meanings.sent3: The joke palled quickly, and no one laughed after the first time.
meanings.sent4: The excitement of the game palled as the score difference widened.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive nature of the task palled on me, and I longed for something new.

meanings.definition: To become less intense or enthusiastic
meanings.sent1: Her enthusiasm for the project palled as the deadlines approached.
meanings.sent2: The cheers from the crowd palled as the team started losing the game.
meanings.sent3: His interest in the hobby palled when he realized how much time it required.
meanings.sent4: The initial excitement palled as the reality of the situation set in.
meanings.sent5: The energy in the room palled as the meeting dragged on.

meanings.definition: To cover with a pall or cloth for the dead
meanings.sent1: The mourners palled the casket with a black cloth before the service.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, it is customary to pall the deceased before burial.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to pall the body in their traditional way.
meanings.sent4: The funeral home offered to pall the deceased for the viewing.
meanings.sent5: The priest carefully palled the body before the final rites.
